intro: Linaria spuria, commonly known as the common toadflax, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and bright yellow or orange flowers that resemble small flax flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas, and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and the flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. Linaria spuria is an annual or biennial plant that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
